page.title: 01NEWTON-IN-FURNESS CUMBRIA
page.content: NEWTON IS SITUATED AT THE SOUTHERN END OF THE FURNESS PENINSULA.SIX KM TO THE EAST IS MORECAMBE BAY,SIX TO THE WEST ,WALNEY ISLAND & THE IRISH SEA ,& SIX TO THE SOUTH, ROA ISLAND. THE VILLAGE HAS SOME PROPERTY OF POST SECOND WORLD WAR ORIGIN,SOME BUILT TO HOUSE PEOPLE WHO WORKED IN THE IRON ORE MINES. BUT THERE IS A NUCLEUS OF OLDER PROPERTY DATING BACK TO THE 18TH CENTURY.THE FORMER C OF E CHURCH & WESLEYAN CHAPEL HAVE BOTH BEEN CONVERTED INTO HOMES.THERE ARE TWO PUBLIC HOUSES,A VILLAGE HALL & A SCHOOL.THE COUNTRYSIDE IS UNDULATING FIELDS DIVIDED BY LIMESTONE WALLS & HEDGEROWS.FOREST TREES ARE FEW IN NUMBER.NEWTONS NEIGHBOURING TOWNS ARE DALTON-IN-FURNESS 2 MILES AWAY, BARROW-IN-FURNESS 4 MILES AWAY.
